member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTPlotRedline API.
member.remarks:
IGTPlotRedline provides access to a redline element of a plot.
The AutomaticTextSource, AutomaticTextFrame, and AutomaticTextField properties are used together to define an automatic field. Only text redline elements can be defined as automatic fields. Setting or reading these properties for other redline elements raises an exception.
The following table illustrates the valid combinations of these three properties:
AutomaticTextSource AutomaticTextFrame AutomaticTextFrame
gtpatNone Not used Not used
gtpatSystemDate Not used Not used
gtpatSystemTime Not used Not used
gtpatSystemUser Not used Not used
gtpatPlotByQuery Not used Field name from query results.
gtpatMapFrameByQuery Map frame name Field name from query results.
gtpatMapFrameByScale Map frame name Not used
gtpatMapFrameByRatio Map frame name Not used
When reading these properties, you must first get the AutomaticTextSource property value and, from that, determine whether the other properties are meaningful. To set the AutomaticTextSource property to a different value, the AutomaticTextFrame and AutomaticTextField properties must have values that are valid for the desired new type of automatic text.
Examples
To change AutomaticTextSource from gtpatNone to gtpatMapFrameByQuery:
First set AutomaticTextFrame to the name of the frame you want to associate with the text and set AutomaticTextField to the name of the field from the query. Then set AutomaticTextSource to gtpatMapFrameByQuery.
To change AutomaticTextSource from gtpatPlotByQuery to gtpatMapFrameByQuery, but keep the same field name:
AutomaticTextField is already set to a valid field name; set AutomaticTextFrame to a valid frame name before setting AutomaticTextSource to gtpatMapFrameByQuery.
To change AutomaticTextSource from gtpatSystemDate to gtpatMapFrameByScale:
Set AutomaticTextFrame to a valid frame name; then set AutomaticTextSource.
To change AutomaticTextSource from gtpatMapFrameByQuery to gtpatPlotByQuery, keeping the same field name:
You need not change any other properties before setting AutomaticTextSource. AutomaticTextField will retain its existing value, and AutomaticTextFrame will become invalid.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.Delete
member.summary: Method to delete this redline.
member.remarks:
The IGTPlotRedline object's properties and methods raise an error if called after the Delete method has been called once.
This method also unselects all redlines that are currently selected.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.AutomaticTextField
member.summary: Property to return/set the query field name for an automatic text field.
member.remarks:
You must set this property before setting AutomaticTextSource to certain values.
Setting this property for redlines that are not text elements raises an exception.
If the specified field does not exist in the results of the query associated with the automatic field, the redline text will display an error string when the automatic fields are updated.
This property cannot be set to the empty string.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.AutomaticTextFrame
member.summary: Property to return/set the plot frame name associated with an automatic text field.
member.remarks:
The value of this property must be the name of a valid map frame in the plot containing this redline, for those values of AutomaticTextSource where this property is valid.
You must set this property before setting AutomaticTextSource to certain values.
Setting this property for redlines that are not text elements raises an exception.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.AutomaticTextSource
member.summary: Property to return/set the source for an automatic text field.
member.remarks:
For redline elements other than text, accessing this property raises an exception. For text elements that are not defined as an automatic field, this property returns gtpatNone.
Before setting this property to gtpatPlotByQuery or gtpatMapFrameByQuery, you must first set the AutomaticTextField property to the name of the field returned by the query that will supply the text.
Before setting this property to gtpatMapFrameByQuery, gtpatMapFrameByScale, or gtpatMapFrameByRatio, you must first set the AutomaticTextFrame property to the name of a valid map frame to which the automatic field is to be associated.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.Frame
member.summary: Property to return the IGTPlotFrame associated with this redline.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.Geometry
member.summary: Property to return/set the geometry associated with this redline element.
member.remarks:
The type of geometry returned depends on the type of redline element.
For text, the geometry is a IGTTextPointGeometry.
For lines, the geometry is always a IGTPolylineGeometry.
For areas, the geometry is always a IGTPolygonGeometry, even if the original redline was created as a rectangle.
This property raises an error for a redline that corresponds to a IGTPlotFrame. To modify the position and extents of a plot frame, use the Range property of IGTPlotFrame. See also the ClipGeometry property of IGTPlotFrame.
All geometry coordinates for redlines are expressed in paper coordinates.
The object returned by this property is a copy of the geometry. If you modify the object returned, it will not affect the redline element unless you set the Geometry property with the modified geometry object.
While G/Technology does not currently support composite geometries for redlines, you should write your code to handle IGTCompositePolygonGeometry and IGTCompositePolylineGeometry as well as IGTPolygonGeometry and IGTPolylineGeometry.
After modifying this property, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the redline to be redrawn.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.StyleID
member.summary: Property to return/set the style ID used to symbolize this redline.
member.remarks:
The style you specify must be an appropriate style type for the type of redline element.
After modifying this property, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the redline to be redrawn.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.Symbology
member.summary: Property to return/set the symbology overrides of the redline element.
member.remarks:
If no override has been set, the corresponding property of the IGTSymbology object will be null.
You can use GTStyleColorConstants instead of a specific RGB value for the Color and FillColor properties of the IGTSymbology object.
After modifying this property, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the redline to be redrawn.
You must set this property after setting the properties of the IGTSymbology object. Modifying the properties of the IGTSymbology object itself has no effect unless you then set the Symbology property.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.Type
member.summary: Property to return the type of this redline element.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.GroupNumber
member.summary: Property to return the group number of this redline.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.ObjectID
member.summary: Property to return/set the object ID of this redline.
member.remarks:
For most redlines, this property is zero. However, when the redline geometry is created using a redline group interface, this property is assigned the G3E_REDLINEGROUPIFACE.G3E_OBJECTID.
When the redline geometry is created using the Insert Legend command, this property is assigned the value, gtroiInsertLegend (-1).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotRedline.UserTag
member.summary: Property to return/set a user-defined string associated with this redline.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTGeometryCreationService API.
member.remarks: The IGTGeometryCreationService object constructs geometry by appending points or subgeometries. As the geometry is constructed, it is displayed in a map window. In addition, the service can validate the constructed geometries. Multiple geometries can be created and displayed simultaneously in one instance of IGTGeometryCreationService.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.AddGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to add the geometry to the collection of geometries of IGTGeometryCreationService.
member.param: The geometry object to be added.
G3E_SNO specifying the style definition to be used to display geometry. Alternately, the StyleID can be one of the GTStyleIDConstants values.
member.remarks:
The method returns the index of the geometry that can be used to reference the geometry when manipulating it later.
The geometry is immediately rendered in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
An error is raised for a nonexistent StyleID.
member.returns: Index of the geometry added to the collection.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.GetGeometry(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the specified geometry.
member.param: The index of the geometry to be returned.
member.remarks:
The dynamic point set by the DynamicPoint property is not present in the geometry object returned by this method.
Polygon and composite polygon geometries are closed before they are returned. If a polygon is not closed, this method appends a point that is identical with the polygon's first point. If a composite polygon is not closed and the last subgeometry is a polyline, an additional point is appended to it that is identical with the composite polygon's first point. If a composite polygon is not closed and the last subgeometry is a complete arc (all three points appended), a two-point polyline is appended connecting the arc end point and composite polygon first point. If the arc is not complete, the end point, identical with the composite polygon first point, is appended.
The geometry is also cleaned up: Any polylines that have fewer than two points are removed.
Example: You append the first point (A) to a composite polyline. Then you append entire arc geometry through AppendGeometryToComposite and the first point of the arc is identical with point A. This leads to a situation where in the composite polyline you have two subgeometries, the "polyline with only the point A" and an arc. Since this is invalid, the polyline will be removed when calling GetGeometry.
When working with boundaries, this method first checks to see if the exterior overlaps any of the holes. If it does, an error is raised. This is an invalid condition.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.GetStyleID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the style ID corresponding to the geometry specified by the index argument.
member.param: The index of the geometry for which the G3E_SNO is being retrieved.
member.remarks: Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveGeometry(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove the specified geometry from the collection of geometries of IGTGeometryCreationService.
member.param: Index of the geometry to be removed.
member.remarks:
The specified geometry will no longer be displayed in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveAllGeometries
member.summary: Method to remove all geometries from the collection of geometries of IGTGeometryCreationService.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.AppendPoint(System.Int32,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to add the specified point to the specified geometry.
member.param: Index of the geometry to which the point will be appended.
The point to be appended.
member.remarks:
If the geometry referenced by Index is a boundary geometry, the point is appended to its exterior. It is not possible to appended points to a boundary's holes. Construct the hole geometries as separate geometries first and then add them to the boundary geometry using AddHole.
The geometry is immediately redrawn in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
This method should be called twice when working with oriented point geometries and text point geometries. The first appended point determines the origin. The second point determines the orientation relative to the origin.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveLastPoint(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove the last appended point from the specified geometry.
member.param: Index of the geometry from which the last point will be removed.
member.remarks:
The geometry will be redrawn in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveAllPoints
member.summary: Method to remove all points from the specified geometry. If no geometry is specified, this method will remove all points from all geometries.
member.remarks: Default value -1 is used for Index.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveAllPoints(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove all points from the specified geometry. If no geometry is specified, this method will remove all points from all geometries.
member.param: Index of the geometry from which the points will be removed.
member.remarks:
Geometries will no longer be displayed in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
This method is different from RemoveAllGeometries because RemoveAllPoints removes no geometries from IGTGeometryCreationService. This method keeps the geometries in IGTGeometryCreationService. However, it resets the geometries as if they were added by CreateGeometry.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveLastGeometryFromComposite(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove the last sub-geometry from the specified composite geometry.
member.param: Index of the composite polygon or composite polyline geometry from which the last subgeometry will be removed.
member.remarks:
The geometry referenced by Index must be a composite polyline, a composite polygon, or a boundary. If boundary geometry, its exterior must be a composite polygon. The subgeometry is removed from its exterior.
The geometry will be redrawn in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.AppendGeometryToComposite(System.Int32,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry)
member.summary: Method to add the specified geometry as the sub-geometry of the specified composite geometry.
member.param: Index of the composite polyline or composite polygon to which the subgeometry will be added.
The subgeometry to be added.
member.remarks:
The geometry referenced by Index must be a composite polyline, a composite polygon or a boundary. If it is a boundary geometry, its exterior must be a composite polygon. The subgeometry is added to the exterior.
It is not possible to add subgeometries to a boundary's holes. Construct the hole geometries as separate geometries first and add them to the boundary geometry using AddHole.
The geometry to be added is always added as a new subgeometry. If there already are some subgeometries in the composite polyline or composite polygon and the subgeometry being appended is not empty, the last point of the last subgeometry is moved so that it is identical with the first point of the subgeometry being appended.
If you do not want to move the last point, then call AppendPoint with the first point of the subgeometry being appended.
The geometry is immediately redrawn in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RefreshDisplay
member.summary: Method to redraw the constructed geometries in the map window.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.CreateGeometry(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to create a geometry of the specified type. The IGTGeometryCreationService will keep the created geometry. Returns the index of the new geometry created.
member.param: The geometry type to be created. The value of this parameter should be one of the items in the enumerated type GTGeometryTypeConstants.
G3E_SNO specifying the style definition to be used to display geometry. Alternately, the StyleID can be one of the GTStyleIDConstants values.
member.remarks:
The method returns the index of the geometry that can be used to reference the geometry when manipulating it later.
The created geometry is empty and has to be further updated by other methods of the IGTGeometryCreationService.
Example: This method creates a polyline geometry with zero points. AppendPoint has to be called to append each point of this polyline geometry.
If a boundary geometry is created, its exterior is automatically created. It is a composite polygon.
An error is raised for a nonexistent StyleID.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.IsGeometryValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to check if the specified geometry is valid.
member.param: Index of the geometry to check for validity.
member.remarks:
These are the conditions when the geometries are considered invalid:
Geometry Type Invalid when
Point Created by appending points and no point has been appended yet.
Oriented Point Created by appending points and fewer than two points have been appended.
Text Point Created by appending points and no point has been appended yet.
Polyline Created by appending points and fewer than two points have been appended.
Polygon The geometry has fewer than three points.
Arc Created by appending points and fewer than three points have been appended.
Composite Polyline It has fewer than two points; or it has more than two points but the last subgeometry is an arc and it has fewer than three points.
Composite Polygon It has fewer than three points; or it has more than three points but the last subgeometry is an arc and it has fewer than three points.
Boundary The exterior is invalid.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.IsGeometryComplete(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to check if the specified geometry is complete.
member.param: Index of the geometry to check for completeness.
member.remarks:
These are the conditions when the geometries are considered incomplete:
Geometry Type Incomplete when
Point Created by appending points and no point has been appended yet.
Oriented Point Created by appending points and fewer than two points have been appended.
Text Point Created by appending points and no point has been appended yet.
Polyline Always incomplete. Use IsGeometyrValid to determine whether there is a sufficient number of points in the geometry.
Polygon The geometry has fewer than three points.
Arc Created by appending points and fewer than three points have been appended.
Composite Polyline, Composite Polygon It has no subgeometry or the last subgeometry is not complete.
Boundary The exterior is incomplete.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.ContainsKickbacks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to check if the specified geometry contains kickbacks. If no kickbacks are present, returns False.
member.param: Index of the geometry to check.
member.remarks:
True is returned if the geometry referenced by Index contains at least one kickback. False is returned if the geometry contains no kickback.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.ContainsLoops(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to check if the specified geometry contains loops. If no loops are present, returns False.
member.param: Index of the geometry to check.
member.remarks:
True is returned if the geometry referenced by Index contains at least one loop. False is returned if the geometry contains no loop.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.AddHole(System.Int32,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry)
member.summary: Method to add a hole (polygon or composite polygon) geometry to the specified boundary geometry.
member.param: Index of the boundary geometry to which the hole is being added.
The hole geometry to be added. Must be polygon or composite polygon geometry.
member.remarks: The method returns the index of the hole in the boundary geometry. This index can be used to retrieve the hole geometry using the GetHole method or to remove the hole using the RemoveHole method. If the hole being added overlaps another hole in the boundary geometry, IGTGeometryCreationService raises an error. The hole geometry is immediately rendered in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.RemoveHole(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove the specified hole geometry from the specified boundary geometry.
member.param: Index of the boundary geometry from which the hole will be removed.
Index of the hole that will be removed.
member.remarks:
The hole geometry will no longer be displayed in the map window referenced by the TargetMapWindow property.
Index is the value returned by Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.
HoleIndex is a value returned by AddHole.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.GetHole(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the specified hole geometry in the specified boundary geometry.
member.param: The index of the boundary geometry for which the hole geometry is being retrieved.
The index of the hole geometry in the boundary geometry referenced by Index.
member.remarks:
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.
HoleIndex is a value returned by AddHole.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.GetArcConstructionMode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the mode in which the points appended to the specified composite geometry will be interpreted.
member.param: The index of the geometry in IGTGeometryCreationService.
member.returns: For arc geometries, the value returned is always True. For all other geometries, the value returned is always False.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.SetArcConstructionMode(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to set the mode in which the points appended to the specified composite geometry will be interpreted.
member.param: The index of the geometry in IGTGeometryCreationService.
For arc geometries, the value of this property is always True. Setting it will raise an error. For all other geometries, the value of this property is always False. Setting it will raise an error.
member.remarks:
Changing the value of this property makes sense only for composite polylines and composite polygons. These geometries are collections of polyline geometries and arc geometries. The default value of this property for composite polylines and composite polygons is False. Therefore, when a point is appended, it is interpreted as the next point of the current polyline subgeometry. In order to append an arc subgeometry, you need to set this property to True. After collecting all needed arc points (see section Arc Construction for detailed discussion about arc construction), the property resets itself to False. Setting this property to False while arc points are being collected removes the last arc subgeometry from the composite polyline or composite polygon. The exterior of a boundary geometry is a composite polygon, therefore this property can be also used while constructing the exterior of a boundary geometry.
Using this property, you can construct only an arc by three points. If other parameters of the arc are known, use one of the following instead:
The API functions for arc computation (and then add the points of the resulting arc in the expected order)
The AddGeometry method.
The AppendGeometryToComposite method.
Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or by CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.SetDynamicPoint(System.Int32,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to set the point for the dynamically displayed geometry (dynamic lines and points) when the geometry is being constructed.
member.param: The index of the geometry in IGTGeometryCreationService to add the dynamic point to.
The IGTPoint to be set.
member.remarks: This property is normally used to display a line or arc between the last point of the constructed geometry and the current position of the mouse cursor. If the custom software receives mouse move events, it would set this property in each mouse move event with the position of the mouse cursor in world coordinates. However, you may set DynamicPoint with any point, not just the current mouse position. The dynamic point is not returned when the geometry identified by Index is returned by the GetGeometry method. When working with oriented point geometries where the origin point has already been appended, setting the dynamic point determines the orientation. Setting this property to Nothing removes dynamic line or arc. Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryCreationService.GetHoleCount(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the number of hole geometries that the specified geometry has.

member.remarks: An error is raised when the geometry identified by Index is not a boundary geometry. Index is the value returned by AddGeometry or CreateGeometry.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTMergeFeaturesService Interface.
member.remarks:
The IGTMergeFeaturesService object provides merge capabilities for custom commands that merge two existing linear features. The API is capable of accepting two proposed features to merge and performs the merge as specified in metadata. You also have the alternative of implementing a silent merge.
See the Merge Subsystem topic for general information about merging.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.CancelMerge
member.summary: Method to cancel the merge of features.
member.remarks: The method is useful if the custom command wants to cancel the merge after another mouse or keyboard event than pressing ESC. CancelMerge does not raise an Aborted event.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.StartMerge(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject)
member.summary: Method to initiate the merge of features.
member.param: The first feature to be merged. This feature will be also updated with the merged data.
The second feature to be merged. After a successful merge, all components of this feature will be deleted.
member.remarks:
The method first determines if it is allowed to merge the two features specified in the input arguments. If it is not, the Disallowed event is raised and DisallowedErrorArray property contains the reasons why merge is not allowed.
A successful merge is communicated to the command by raising the Finished event. If the merge is not approved, a Disapproved event is raised, and the DisapprovedErrorArray property contains the reasons why.
If the merge is not successful for any reason, an Aborted event is raised.
If all components can be merged without any feedback from the user, the control returns to the command after the merge has been completed. If there is a component that is merged with a feedback from the user, the control returns back to the command when the Merge Features control is displayed and the user is prompted to select the merge option. The command should ignore any user events until the merge is complete. IGTMergeFeaturesService receives those events in parallel with the command.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.DisallowedErrorArray
member.summary: Property to return the reasons why merge was not allowed.
member.remarks: If the merge is allowed, this property returns a Null variant. If the merge is not allowed, the return value is a variant containing a 2 x N array of strings, where N is number of reasons why the merge was not allowed. The first "column" in this array contains an error description and the second "column" contains the error location, such as the name of the Node-Edge Connectivity relationship that would become invalid after the merge. This property is set before the Disallowed event is raised so that the custom command can display the reasons for not allowing the merge instead of letting IGTMergeFeaturesService display them.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.DisapprovedErrorArray
member.summary: Property to return the reasons why merge was not approved.
member.remarks: If the merge is approved, this property returns a Null variant. If the merge is not approved, the return value is a variant containing a 2 x N array of strings, where N is number of reasons why the merge was not approved. The first "column" in this array contains an error description and the second "column" contains the error location, such as the name of the Node-Edge Connectivity relationship that would become invalid after the merge. This property is set before the Disapproved event is raised so that the custom command can display the reasons for not approving the merge instead of letting IGTMergeFeaturesService display them.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.ErrorDialogCaption
member.summary: Property to return/set the Error Dialog Caption.
member.remarks: Initially, this property does not have to be set. It can be set in the Disallowed or Disapproved event handler when it is clear whether allow or approve failed. The default value is an empty string, which implies that the standard caption is shown.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.ErrorDialogMessage
member.summary: Property to return/set the Error Dialog text.
member.remarks: Initially, this property does not have to be set. It can be set in the Disallowed or Disapproved event handler when it is clear whether allow or approve failed. The default value is an empty string, which implies that the standard caption is shown.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.Disallowed
member.summary: Event raised when the merge is not allowed.
member.remarks: If the command lets IGTMergeFeaturesService display the dialog box, it can set the IGTMergeFeaturesService ErrorDialogBoxCaption and ErrorDialogBoxMessage properties to customize the caption and message on the dialog box. The StartMerge method may not be called from this event handler.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.Disapproved
member.summary: Event raised when the merge is not approved.
member.remarks: If the command lets GTMergeFeaturesService display the dialog box, it can set the IGTMergeFeaturesService ErrorDialogBoxCaption and ErrorDialogBoxMessage properties to customize the caption and message on the dialog box. The StartMerge method may not be called from this event handler.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.Aborted
member.summary: Event raised when the merge has been aborted.
member.remarks:
This event is raised when:
A runtime error occurs in IGTMergeFeaturesService in a place other than in StartMerge, such as in the process of selecting merge options.
The merge is not allowed or not approved, after displaying the dialog box with reasons for not allowing or approving the merge.
The custom command should roll back the database transaction in this event handler.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMergeFeaturesService.Finished
member.summary: Event raised when the merge has been completed successfully.
member.remarks: If the custom command merges several features one after another, it can call the StartMerge method from this event handler with the references to the next two features to be merged. The custom command may commit the database transaction in this event handler.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTMeasureService API.
member.remarks:
The IGTMeasureService object provides the automation for calculating the area, length, and perimeter of a geometry object. Before performing the calculations, a CoordSystem object, the reference space, and the geometry object for which the calculations are made must be specified. Referencing the applicable property or executing a method returns the measurements.
The calculations that can be performed depend on the type of geometry object being measured.
Example:
The area of a line or a point is not calculated. Therefore, referencing the Area property for either of these geometry objects returns a calculation of zero.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.PointFromDistanceAndAzimuth(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to return a point a given distance (in meters) and an azimuth (in radians) away from a point in the specified reference space.
member.param: The distance in meters from the IGTMeasureService.Geometry point object to the generated point.
The azimuth in radians (defined clockwise from north) defining the direction from the IGTMeasureService.Geometry point object to the generated point.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.Area
member.summary: Property to return the area (in square meters) of the specified geometry object. The return value depends on the geometry type and reference space.
member.remarks:
The return value depends on the geometry type.
Geometry Object Return Value
IGTPointGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTOrientedPointGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTTextPointGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTLineGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTArcGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTPolylineGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTCompositePolylineGeometry Always returns 0.
IGTPolygonGeometry Returns the area of the polygon.
IGTCompositePolygonGeometry Returns the area of the polygon.
IGTBoundaryGeometry Returns the area of the PolygonGeometry boundary minus the PolygonGeometry holes.
IGTGeometryCollection Cumulative area of all geometries in the collection.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.BackAzimuth
member.summary: Property to return the back azimuth in radians of a line or 2-point linestring geometry in the specified reference space.
member.remarks: Azimuths are computed only for lines and two-point line strings. All other geometries return a value of 0.0.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.CoordSystem
member.summary: Property to return/set the coordinate system to use for reference space transformation. If DataContext has been set, there is no need to set this property, unless you would like to measure in a coordinate system different from the current configuration.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.DataContext
member.summary: Property to return/set the IGTDataContext object associated with this service. This property indirectly specifies that the coordinate system of the current configuration will be used. If this property is set, there is no need to specify CoordSystem.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMeasureService.ForwardAzimuth
member.summary: Property to return the forward azimuth in radians of a line or 2-point linestring geometry in the specified reference space.
member.remarks: Azimuths are computed only for lines and two-point line strings. All other geometries return a value of 0.0.

item.description: Always returns 0.
Always returns 0.
Always returns 0.

Always returns length from starting to ending points.

member.summary: Property to return/set the active reference space used for performing measurements. Projected measurements are taken in the projection plane and have distortions. Geographic measurements are performed on the ellipsoid's surface (no distortions).

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.CenterSelectedObjects
member.summary: Method to center the set of selected objects in the map.
member.remarks:
The center point of IGTApplication.SelectedObjects is determined using the center of the MBR of all selected geometries.
If there is no object in IGTApplication.SelectedObjects, this method returns without error.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.FitSelectedObjects
member.summary: Method to fit the set of selected objects in the map.
member.remarks: Default value 1.0 is used for ZoomFactor.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.FitSelectedObjects(System.Double)
member.summary: Method to fit the set of selected objects in the map.
member.param: The zoom factor to use when fitting the selected objects collection.
member.remarks: If ZoomFactor is less than or equal to 1.0, no zoom out operation will be performed. If there is no object in IGTApplication.SelectedObjects this method does nothing and returns without error.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.GetRange
member.summary: Method to return the range of the map.
member.remarks: Resizing the window or recentering, panning, or zooming the objects in the IGTMapWindow changes the range values.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.WindowToWorld(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to convert a window point to a world point.
member.param: The window point to convert.
member.remarks: The world coordinate value is in the same units as all other geometry in the published DDC files.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.WorldToWindow(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to convert a world point to a window point.
member.param: The world point to convert.
member.remarks:
The geometry in published DDC files is in world coordinates. Thus, geometry obtained from a IGTDDCKeyObject has coordinates in ground units.
The following events from IGTCustomCommandHelper supply both a world point and its corresponding window point.
Click
DblClick
MouseDown
MouseMove
MouseUp
WheelRotate

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.WorldToWindowDistance(System.Double)
member.summary: Method to convert a world distance to a window distance.
member.param: The world distance to convert.
member.remarks: The WorldToWindowDistance method converts a world distance to a window distance (in pixels).

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.WindowToWorldDistance(System.Double)
member.summary: Method to convert a window distance to a world distance.
member.param: The window distance to convert.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.ZoomArea(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTWorldRange)
member.summary: Method to zoom to the range of the given area.
member.param: The area for which the zoom will occur.
member.remarks:
The ZoomArea method fills the IGTMapWindow with the portion of the display contained within a specified rectangular area.
The rectangular area is defined by specifying its lower-left and upper-right corners in world coordinates through the IGTWorldRange object. The objects in the IGTMapWindow resize proportionally to fill the window.
The map window is refreshed automatically after the zoom operation.

member.summary: Property to return the map detail identifier.
member.remarks: By default, if the IGTMapWindow does not contain a detail view, the DetailID returns a value of 0.

member.summary: Property to return/set the map display scale.
member.remarks: Setting this property to a value less than 1 will result in an error message. Setting the display scale automatically changes the internal view matrix. This property takes places immediately and there is no need to perform a refresh.

This name maps to the G3E_USERNAME field in G3E_LEGENDS_OPTABLE.

member.summary: Property to return the IGTLocateService for this map.

member.summary: Property to return/set the map mouse pointer.

member.summary: Property to return the map referencing FNO.
member.remarks: By default, the ReferencingFNO property returns a value of 0 when no referencing feature exists.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.SelectBehavior
member.summary: Property to return/set the map select behavior.
member.remarks:
The SelectBehavior property returns or sets the selection behavior for the GTMapWindowhighlight only, highlight and fit, or highlight and center.
Changes to this property are effective on the next select operation.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.SelectBehaviorZoomFactor
member.summary: Property to return/set the map select behavior zoom factor.
member.remarks:
The SelectBehaviorZoomFactor property is used by the highlight-and-fit operation of the SelectBehavior property to determine the division factor applied to an object's display size when a fit occurs. A larger value results in the selected objects' displaying at a smaller scale.
The SelectBehaviorZoomFactor property is set to 1.05 by default.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMapWindow.WindowState
member.summary: Property to return/set the map window state.
member.remarks: The WindowState property returns or sets the statemaximize, minimize, or restoreof the IGTMapWindow.

member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTHelperService API.

member.summary: Method to run a user-defined post process interface.

Query result to report.
The type of post-process operation to run.
member.remarks:
There must be an active job when calling this method. If there is no active job, an error is raised.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.RunComputeMarkerLocation(ADODB.Recordset,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to run a user-defined compute marker location interface.
member.param: The recordset containing all the candidate features.
Input stop criteria value.
The relation interface number that corresponds to the Compute Marker Location object.
The relation interface argument group number that corresponds to the Compute Marker Location object.
member.remarks:
This method can be called only in the desktop implementation of a Report object.
This method returns a recordset containing all the marker location points computed based on the specified stop criteria values.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.RunComputeGeoPoint(ADODB.Recordset,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to run a user-defined compute geo point interface.
member.param: The input recordset containing the computed marker location points for the geographic window.
The relation interface number that corresponds to the Compute GeoPoint object.
The relation interface argument group number that corresponds to the Compute GeoPoint object.
member.remarks:
This method can be called only in the desktop implementation of a Report object.
If there are no computed marker location points in the detail window, this method returns the input recordset. Otherwise, this method adds the marker location points projected back to the geo window for each computed marker location point in the detail window.

member.summary: Method to run a user-defined create marker interface.
member.param: Contains all the coordinate location points for the markers.
Contains the name of trace executed for computing marker location.
The relation interface number that corresponds to the Create Marker object.
The relation interface argument group number that corresponds to the Create Marker object.
member.remarks:
After this method is executed, the markers are created at the specified location points.
This method can be called only in the desktop implementation of a Report object.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.GetComponentLabel(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject,System.Int16,System.String@,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTAlignmentConstants@)
member.summary: Method to return a label and its alignment for the input component (CNO) of the input IGTKeyObject.
member.param: Key object defining the feature component.
CNO of the component whose label and alignment are to be returned.
The label for the input CNO.
The alignment for the input CNO.
member.remarks:
This method can be called only in a desktop application context. That is, it cannot be called from interfaces that batch executables instantiate, such as BatchValidation.exe.
This method supports only the gtctGraphicText(1024) component type (G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_TYPE).
Each component's recordset represented in the KeyObject's Components collection is expected to be on the appropriate row for attribute evaluation.
The output label is determined by evaluating the label rule (G3E_LRNO) that comes from the G3E_LEGENDENTRY table where G3E_LENO = G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_LENO. G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_LENO is the LENO where G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_CNO matches the input CNO and G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_FNO matches the input KeyObject's FNO.
The output alignment is determined from the component's alignment field as identified by G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_ALIGNMENTFIELD.
If the input component is not gtctGraphicText or is secondary data, then an error is raised.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.GetComponentStyleID(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject,System.Int16)
member.summary: Method to return a StyleID used to draw the input component (CNO) of the input IGTKeyObject.
member.param: Key object defining the feature component.
CNO of the component whose style ID is to be returned.
member.remarks:
This method can be called only in a desktop application context. That is, it cannot be called from interfaces that batch executables instantiate, such as BatchValidation.exe.
This method does not support the following component types (G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_TYPE):
gtctNonGraphic(1)
gtctSpecialNonGraphic(2048)
gtctSpatialCoverage(32)
The gtctSpecialNonGraphic component type is not likely to be encountered since components of this type cannot be part of a feature. If the input component is one of these types, an error is raised.
Each component's recordset represented in the KeyObject's Components collection is expected to be on the appropriate row for attribute evaluation.
The output style ID is determined by evaluating the style rule (G3E_SRNO) that comes from the G3E_LEGENDENTRY table where G3E_LENO = G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_LENO. G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_LENO is the LENO where G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_CNO matches the input CNO and G3E_COMPONENTVIEWDEFINITION.G3E_FNO matches the input KeyObject's FNO.
For the gtctDimension component type, the style ID for the dimension line is returned where G3E_DIMSTYLEGROUP.G3E_DIMSEGMENT = 1.
If a style ID cannot be determined by evaluating a style rule, then the default style ID for the input CNO is returned.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.RunCustomValidation(System.String,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObjects,ADODB.Recordset@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to run a user-defined feature validation interface.
member.param: The context in which the validation interface is being called. The validation interface's Validate method can be coded to perform different types of validation depending on the value of the processing mode.
The collection of IGTKeyObjects to be validated by the interface.

The recordset of validation errors found by the validation interface. This recordset can be created by the caller or by the function. If the recordset passed in is Nothing, the function will create the recordset.
The relation interface number that corresponds to the validation interface to be run. The RINO must correspond to a G3E_RINO value in the G3E_FEATURE or G3E_PLACEMENTCONFIGURATION table.

The relation interface argument group number that corresponds to arguments for this validation interface. The RIARGGROUPNO must correspond to a G3E_RIARGGROUPNO value in the G3E_RELATIONIFACEARGS table. Specify a value of 0 if no arguments are needed for this interface.
member.remarks:
The ValidationErrors recordset has following fields:
Field Type Max Length Description
Error Priority adVarWChar 500 Contains the priority of the error that was detected while validating the feature.
ErrorDescription adVarWChar 500 Contains the descriptive text of the error.
ErrorLocation adVarWChar 500 Identifies the name of the module or phase of validation. You can define this semantic.
Connection adVarWChar 500 Value from DataContext.ConfigurationName. The active connection is assumed, so you need not supply a value for this field.
G3E_FNO adInteger n/a The feature number.
G3E_FID adInteger n/a The feature identifier.
G3E_CNO adInteger n/a The component number.
G3E_CID adInteger n/a The component occurrence.
This method lets you code the Validate method for a placement configuration to call the validation interfaces of the individual features that make up that configuration.
When using RunCustomValidation to call validation interfaces for for a placement configuration, be conscious of any message boxes, status bar prompts, or validation errors that are displayed in the validation interfaces for the features. Ideally, the validation functions for the features should be implemented so that they can defer display of such information to the calling validation interface for the placement configuration whenever the ProcessingMode contains a G3E_PCNO value.
The DataContext property of the IGTHelperService object must be set before calling the RunCustomValidation function. If it is not set when this function is called, an error will occur, a failure status will be returned, and the interface will terminate.
If the RINO cannot be found in the G3E_FEATURE or G3E_PLACEMENTCONFIGURATION table, or if the G3E_PRJNO is not set for this RINO in the G3E_RELATIONINTERFACE table, an error will occur, a failure status will be returned, and the interface will terminate.
If an invalid RIARGGROUPNO is specified, no arguments will be set on the interface. No error will occur.
If the validation interface encounters an unexpected problem while setting its properties or calling the Validate method, RunCustomValidation will raise an error, return a failing status of False, and terminate.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTHelperService.DisplayHTML(System.String,System.String)

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTApplication API.
member.remarks:
The Intergraph G/Technology IGTApplication object represents a single instance of G/Technology and contains methods and properties to control the application through automation. This is the top-level object in the automation model.
The IGTApplication object has very limited use within batch executables like Batch Validation and Job Life Cycle.
Furthermore, the IGTApplication object cannot be used at all from interfaces that are executed within G/Technology NetViewer.
The application interface provides access to the following:
The active database connection
Map windows
Selected objects
Properties
Services Units of measure
Preferences
The interface also provides the following information and controls:
Creation of new map and detail windows
Window arrangement and refresh
Control of the status bar text, progress bar, and cursor states
Changes to preferences
Changes to selected objects
Changes to the active job
You can get the instance through GTClassFactory.Create<IGTApplication>() call.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.GetStatusBarText(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTStatusPanelConstants)
member.summary: Method to get the status bar text in a given panel.
member.param: The panel from which to retrieve the text.

member.summary: Method to set the status bar text in a given panel.
member.param: The panel on which to set the text.
The text value.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.ArrangeWindows(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTWindowActionConstants)
member.summary: Method to arrange the application windows.
member.param: The window arrangement.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.RefreshWindows
member.summary: Method to repaint each window in the application.
member.remarks: Only the dirty areas from the windows will be redrawn, not the entire window.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.NewMapWindow
member.summary: Method to create a new map window given a legend.
member.remarks:
Default value string.Empty is used for LegendName.
When a new map window is created without a specified legend, an empty legend is created for that map window.
The new map window appears on top of all other map windows and becomes the active map window. When the window is created, the map will not automatically paint. After calling this method, you must call IGTApplication's RefreshWindows to cause the new window to be redrawn.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.NewMapWindow(System.String)
member.summary: Method to create a new map window given a legend.
member.remarks:
The new map window appears on top of all other map windows and becomes the active map window. When the window is created, the map will not automatically paint.
If the open window fails because the current user does not have permission to access the specified legend, then the window should close.
After calling this method, you must call IGTApplication's RefreshWindows to cause the new window to be redrawn.
member.param: The name of an existing legend to be used with the new window. This name maps to the G3E_USERNAME field in G3E_LEGENDS_OPTABLE

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.OpenDetailWindow(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to open an existing detail drawing in a new map window.
member.remarks:
The detail window appears on top of all other map windows and becomes the active map window. When the window is created, the map will not automatically paint. You must call IGTApplication.RefreshWindows. New detail windows need to be closed if they were created during a database transaction.
If the open window fails because the current user does not have permission to access the specified legend, then the window should close.
member.param: The name of an existing legend to be used with the new window. This name maps to the G3E_USERNAME field in G3E_LEGENDS_OPTABLE.
The detail ID of the detail to be opened.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTApplication.EndWaitCursor

member.remarks: The EndProgressBar method renders the progress bar invisible. This method is used after the progress has reached the upper limit and the progress bar is no longer required.

The upper limit for the progress range.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlacementTechniqueEventMode
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTPlacementTechniqueEventMode Interface.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlacementTechniqueEventMode.RelationshipProcessingEnabled
member.summary: Property to return/set whether relationships should be processed after the event through which this object is passed.
member.remarks:
The default value for this property is True, which means relationship processing is enabled and will occur for the mouse event.
If the IGTPlacementTechnique sets this property to False, then relationship processing is disabled for the current mouse event. Relationship processing is automatically re-enabled for all subsequent mouse events.
The IGTPlacementTechnique must reset this flag to False for every call to a mouse event where relationship processing should be disabled. Disabling relationships on mouse click and key up events should be used in combination to keep relationship processing synchronized. Note the following:
Setting this flag to False during a mouse move prevents relationship candidates from being highlighted.
Setting this flag to False during a mouse click prevents relationships from being established at the location of the mouse click.
Setting this flag to False during a keyup for a backspace prevents relationships from being deleted for the point that was removed.
Relationship processing is resumed once the technique signals that it is done, regardless of the value of this flag. At a minimum, relationships will be established at the start and end points of the completed geometry once the technique finishes.

The IGTPlacementTechnique must reset this flag to False for every call to a mouse event where relationship processing should be disabled. Disabling relationships on mouse click and key up events should be used in combination to keep relationship processing synchronized. Note the following:
Setting this flag to False during a mouse move prevents relationship candidates from being highlighted.
Setting this flag to False during a mouse click prevents relationships from being established at the location of the mouse click.
Setting this flag to False during a keyup for a backspace prevents relationships from being deleted for the point that was removed.
Relationship processing is resumed once the technique signals that it is done, regardless of the value of this flag. At a minimum, relationships will be established at the start and end points of the completed geometry once the technique finishes.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants
member.summary:
The GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants enumeration is used with the GTCompositePolylineGeometry.ReplaceVertexByFillet function.
The following values can be used by the caller to determine whether the replacement succeeded or find out why the replacement did not take place.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfSuccess
member.summary: The vertex has been successfully replaced by the fillet arc.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfInvalidRadius
member.summary: Radius must be greater than 0.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfInvalidGeometryType
member.summary: The input geometry must be either composite polygon or composite polyline.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfCannotReplaceFirstVertex
member.summary: The first vertex of composite polyline cannot be replaced by a fillet.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfCannotReplaceLastVertex
member.summary: The last vertex of composite polyline cannot be replaced by a fillet.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfInvalidKeyPointIndex
member.summary: Invalid key point index (must be greater than 0 and less or equal than key point count).

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfCannotManipulateArcItem
member.summary: The specified key point and its adjacent key points must be polyline vertices. This method does not adjust any of the existing arc items in the input geometry.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfInvalidPolylineItem
member.summary: A polyline item with less than 2 points present in the composite polyline/polygon.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfInvalidCompositeGeometryItem
member.summary: An item that is neither polyline nor arc present in the composite polyline/polygon.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfRadiusTooLarge
member.summary: The specified radius is too large. The calculated fillet arc cannot be merged with the line segment(s) adjacent to the specified key point.

member.name: F:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTReplaceVertexByFilletConstants.gtrvfCannotCalculateFilletArc
member.summary: Cannot calculate the fillet arc. The input geometry may contain overlapping vertices or collinear line segments.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTZoneService API.
member.remarks:
The IGTZoneService object can be used by custom command software or any of the Microsoft Visual Basic for Applications interfaces to generate zones around features and merge areas. This service supports both merging and zone generation independently as well as enables the possibility to combine zoning and merging in one step.
For general information about configuring the sample Temporary Geometry Placement interface, see Customizing the Sample Temporary Geometry Placement Interfaces.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService.InputGeometries
member.summary: Property to return/set the geometries which should be processed (around which the zone should be created or which should be merged).
member.remarks:
All geometries are expected to be in the same units and in the coordinate system of the published configuration.
The InputGeometries property accepts the following types of input objects:
IGTPointGeometry
IGTOrientedPointGeometry
IGTLineGeometry
IGTArcGeometry
IGTPolylineGeometry
IGTCompositePolylineGeometry
IGTPolygonGeometry
IGTCompositePolygonGeometry
IGTBoundaryGeometry
In addition to this set of objects, the property also accepts a IGTGeometryCollection. This collection is expected to contain any combination of the above mentioned geometry types.
If the object set using this property is not any of the above mentioned types, an error is raised.
The content of the IGTGeometryCollection is also verified and an error is raised if the collection contains an object of a type that is not supported. However, this is done in the OutputGeometries property because the content of the collection can change between these two calls.
The following geometry types are not supported:
IGTRasterGeometry
IGTTextPointGeometry
When a zone around a polygon or composite polygon (area) geometry is generated, the result is an area larger by ZoneWidth.
When a zone around a boundary geometry with a hole is generated, the result is a larger area (by ZoneWidth) with a smaller hole (which might be omitted completely if the hole size is smaller than ZoneWidth/2).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService.LinearZoneEndCapType
member.summary: Property to return/set the end cap type of the zone that will be created for linear geometries. Ignored for non-linear geometries.
member.remarks:
Specifying the LinearZoneEndCapType tells the service to create either a round or rectangular end cap when creating the zone around a linear geometry. If the LinearZoneEndCapType is not specified, the service defaults to round end caps.
This property applies to linear geometries only. It is ignored for point and area geometries. You cannot get rectangular or square zones around point features.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService.Merged
member.summary: Property to return/set a flag determining if the area geometries that overlap each other should be returned as one merged geometry. Default is False.
member.remarks:
Specifying the Merged property tells the service to return the geometries merged where possible. For instance, if two lines with an intersection are the geometry input for the service, the result will be one of the following:
One zone A zone around both input lines if Merged is set to True.
Two zones One zone around each of the input lines if Merged is set to False. As the lines intersect, there will be an area where the resulting areas overlap each other.
If the Merged property is set to True and ZoneWidth is set to 0 and the InputGeometries collection of features contains geometries other than polygon, composite polygon, or boundary, an error is raised.
The default value is False.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService.OutputGeometries
member.summary: Property to return the resulting (zone or merged) geometries.
member.remarks:
A collection with no geometries is returned if no geometries have been set using the InputGeometries property.
Regardless from the number of geometries set by the InputGeometries property, the output of this property will always be a IGTGeometryCollection.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTZoneService.ZoneWidth
member.summary: Property to return/set the width of the zone to be created around input geometries.
member.remarks:
The ZoneWidth is specified in the units of coordinate system of geometry.
Specifying a negative ZoneWidth for point features results in the point geometries' not being present in the output collection of geometries.
Specifying a negative ZoneWidth for area geometries will shrink the area geometry.
When set to 0, the input geometries are not to be modified.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTTextPointGeometry API.
member.remarks:
IGTTextPointGeometry represents a textual label with a position and rotation.
The IGTTextPointGeometry object consists of an origin point, text (formatted as rich or ordinary text), an indicator of how the text is formatted, a rotation angle, an alignment, and a normal unit vector.
The origin point is stored as a IGTPoint object in the Origin property. The coordinates for the origin can be returned or modified through the X, Y, and Z properties of the IGTPoint object.
The normal unit vector is stored as a IGTVector object in the Normal property. The components of the normal unit vector can be returned or modified through the I, J, and K properties of the Vector object.
All IGTTextPointGeometry objects have an angle of rotation. The rotation and the normal unit vector are calculated in relation to the origin point.
A feature stored as a IGTTextPointGeometry object is rendered at the stored rotation and normal unit vector. The amount of rotation in degrees is read from storage and is applied counterclockwise from the origin point. Likewise, the normal unit vector is read from storage and applied to the feature.
IGTTextPointGeometry is used only related to secondary published databases and in the display pathway.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPointGeometry
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTPointGeometry API.
member.remarks:
The point is stored as a IGTPoint object in the Origin property. The coordinates for the origin can be returned or modified through the X, Y, and Z properties of the IGTPoint object.
A IGTPoint is distinct from the IGTPointGeometry in that the IGTPoint object is an X, Y, Z position in space that describes higher geometry objects. This point can be a member of the IGTPoints collection. As a members of the collection, IGTPoint objects describe multiple positions in a IGTPolylineGeometry object or a IGTPolylgonGeometry object.
The IGTPointGeometry object is a type of geometry object as are IGTLineGeometry, IGTPolylineGeometry, and IGTPolylgonGeometry objects. This IGTPointGeometry object can be a member of the IGTGeometryCollection object.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPointGeometry.Origin
member.summary: The Origin property returns the origin point or sets a point of reference that is used to determine the normal vector. This origin point is used to determine alignment, rotation, height and width, normal vectors, and so forth.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.Alignment
member.summary: Returns or sets the alignment of the geometry's position with its bounding box. The 9 possible values correspond to the 4 corners of the bounding box, the 4 centers of each edge of the bounding box, and the center of the box. The Alignment determines where the text appears relative to the Origin (the position) of the geometry.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.Format
member.summary:
Returns an indicator of the format of the text.
A property value of gtfmtRichText indicates that the text is in Rich Text format. The property value gtfmtUnGTFormatted indicates plain unformatted text.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.Normal
member.summary: Returns or sets the vector that represents normal to the plane in which the textpoint geometry lies.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.RichText
member.summary: Returns or sets the rich text stored with the IGTTextPointGeometry object. This text must be in rich text format.
member.remarks: Text set by the RichText property is stored only if the Format property is set for rich text(gmfRichText).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.Rotation
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation in degrees of the text geometry.
member.remarks: This rotation angle is measured counterclockwise from the origin point. The new rotation angle is not stored until the applicable record is updated with the new geometry.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTTextPointGeometry.Text
member.summary: Returns or sets the unformatted text stored with the IGTTextPointGeometry object.
member.remarks: Text set by the Text property is stored only if the Format property is set for unformatted text(gmfUnformatted).

member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTNamedPlot API.
member.remarks: IGTNamedPlot provides access to the properties and methods of a named plot. A named plot is a named layout of a single sheet of paper containing maps, embedded objects, and redlines to be printed.

member.param: The name of the new plot to create.

member.summary: Method to get a collection of plot redlines for this plot.
member.param: The type of redlines to retrieve. Defaults to gtprcAll.
member.remarks: The collection of redlines returned is not simply a snapshot of the current state; the collection may be implicitly modified if redlines are added to the plot after calling GetRedlines.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTNamedPlot.CreateCustomInterface(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to create a custom plot interface.
member.param: The G3E_RINO index for the interface to be created.
member.remarks: This allows a custom command to call the interface. It also allows you to test and debug your custom interface interactively and to reuse code from the custom interface for your command.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTNamedPlot.NewRedline(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to create a new plot redline.
member.param: The geometry of the new redline. The type of geometry must be IGTPolygonGeometry for an area, IGTPolylineGeometry for a line, IGTOrientedPointGeometry for a point, or IGTTextPointGeometry for text.
The style number for the new redline. To override aspects of this style, use the Symbology property of the returned GTRedline object to do so.
member.remarks: Default value GTPlotRedlineGroupNumberConstants.gtprgNoGroupNumber is used for GroupNumber.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTNamedPlot.NewRedline(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to create a new plot redline.
member.param: he group number assigned to the new redline unless omitted or new. If GroupNumber is gtprgNoGroupNumber (0) or is not supplied, the new redline is not assigned to a new or existing group. If GroupNumber is gtprgNewGroupNumber (-1), the new redline is assigned to a new group. The programmer can use the returned IGTPlotRedline's GroupNumber in a subsequent call to add geometries to the same group. If GroupNumber is greater than 0, the new redline element is associated with the input GroupNumber. The behavior is undefined if this value is not the same as the GroupNumber attribute of an existing GTPlotRedline object. If GroupNumber is less than -1 or greater than the last group number used by the GTNamedPlot, an error is raised.
The style number for the new redline. To override aspects of this style, use the Symbology property of the returned GTRedline object to do so.
The geometry of the new redline. The type of geometry must be IGTPolygonGeometry for an area, IGTPolylineGeometry for a line, IGTOrientedPointGeometry for a point, or IGTTextPointGeometry for text.
member.remarks: You cannot create a new object or map frame using NewRedline. Use the InsertMap, InsertObjectFromFile, or InsertObjectFromProgID methods of IGTPlotWindow instead.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTFeatureExplorerService Object.
member.remarks: The IGTFeatureExplorerService object lets you use Feature Explorer to place, edit, and review features.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.Clear
member.summary: Method to clear the contents of Feature Explorer.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.ExploreFeature(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject,System.String)
member.summary: Method to load a single feature into Feature Explorer.
member.param: The GTKeyObject for the feature that is to be explored.
The type of dialog box to use when exploring the specified feature.
member.remarks:
There are three predefined values for dialog type: "Review", "Edit", and "Placement." In addition to these values, the command can pass in a dialog-box name defined in metadata in G3E_DIALOG.G3E_TYPE. For ExploreFeature, the dialog type must be set up for a single feature. The allowed values for DialogType for a given feature are determined by the result of the following query:
select distinct(g3e_type) from g3e_dialog where g3e_fno = [feature number]
When displaying tabs, FeatureExplorer uses the following query to determine which tabs are to be displayed:
select * from g3e_dialogs_optable where g3e_type = [DialogType] and g3e_fno = [feature number]
When the DialogType parameter is "Review," the tree view is enabled and traversable. If the DialogType parameter is any other value, the tree view is disabled, the Locked property is set to True, and the Edit toolbar is displayed.
If this method is called with any dialog type aside from "Review," a transaction should begin before this call is made. The command is responsible for transaction management. Otherwise, the edits made to the feature will not be saved when the database is updated.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.ExploreFeatures(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObjects,System.String)
member.summary: Method to load multiple features into Feature Explorer.
member.param: The GTKeyObjects object for the feature to be explored.
The type of dialog box to use when exploring the specified feature.
member.remarks:
The predefined values for dialog type described in the ExploreFeature method are not permitted for this method. The command must pass in a dialog type name defined in G3E_DIALOG.G3E_TYPE.
For ExploreFeatures, no validation is done to make sure that the feature types required for the configuration are present in the KeyObjects collection. If a feature present in the GTKeyObjects collection has a tab or set of tabs defined, that feature is displayed. Otherwise, that feature is not displayed.
The list of tabs defined for a DialogType can be found by the following query:
select * from g3e_dialogs_optable where g3e_type = [DialogType]
Specifying this method always puts Feature Explorer in Edit mode; that is, the Edit toolbar is displayed, the tree view is disabled, and the Locked property is set to True.
A transaction should begin before this call is made. The command is responsible for transaction management. Otherwise, edits made to the feature will not be saved when the database is updated.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.Slide(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to slide Feature Explorer out or in.
member.param: Specifies whether the control is sliding out or sliding in. If True, Feature Explorer is slid out. If False, Feature Explorer is slid in.
member.remarks: The current state of Feature Explorer is not a consideration when calling this method.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.CancelClick
member.summary: Event raised when the cancel button is clicked on the Feature Explorer toolbar.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.SaveAndContinueClick
member.summary: Event raised when the save and continue button is clicked on the Feature Explorer toolbar.

member.name: E:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.SaveClick
member.summary: Event raised when the save button is clicked on the Feature Explorer toolbar.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.Locked
member.summary: Property to return/set whether the select set synchronization behavior of Feature Explorer is locked.
member.remarks:
The Locked property is set to True by a command to lock FeatureExplorer so that it does not try to stay in sync with the select set.
This property is automatically set to True if the DialogType parameter for ExploreFeature or ExploreFeatures is any value other than "Review".
This property is set to False by a command to release FeatureExplorer after use. This action hides the Edit toolbar if it is visible. It also allows the synchronization between Feature Explorer and the select set to continue.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTFeatureExplorerService.Visible
member.summary: Property to return/set whether or not Feature Explorer is visible.
member.remarks: This is not an indication of whether Feature Explorer is slid in or out, but rather if it is visible within the framework.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTEliminationComponent
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTEliminationComponent API.

member.summary: Property to return/set the CID of the component instance to be destined.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTEliminationComponent.CNO
member.summary: Property to return/set the CNO of the component instance to be destined.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTEliminationComponent.Destination
