member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTBoundaryGeometry
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTBoundaryGeometry API.
member.remarks:
IGTBoundaryGeometry represents a polygon with excluded interior regions. Typically, the exterior geometry is a polygon geometry, although it may be a closed polyline geometry, that defines the boundary geometry extents. It is created separately from the IGTBoundaryGeometry Object and is then assigned to the IGTBoundaryGeometry.Exterior property.
Interior regions are geometry objects that are completely contained within the area of the exterior geometry and must not overlap each other. The collection of interior regions is a IGTGeometryCollection object that is automatically created when the IGTBoundaryGeometry is created. It is stored in the IGTBoundaryGeometry.Holes property.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTBoundaryGeometry.GetComponentKeypointIndexOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: The GetComponentKeypointIndexOffset function returns the offset from which keypoint indexes begin for a specific component in the given geometry object.
member.remarks:
A geometry object which can have component geometries, such as a GeometryCollection object, contains all of the keypoints defined by its components. It is sometimes necessary to find out what the index of a keypoint defined by a certain component is in the scope of the parent geometry.
Example: A certain GeometryCollection object, P, contains two components C1 and C2. C1 (a PolylineGeometry) has 5 keypoints, and C2 (an ArcGeometry) has 3 keypoints. Therefore, P has a total of 8 keypoints. To find the index of C2s second keypoint within the scope of P, you can use GetComponentKeypointIndexOffset. The keypoint index offset for C2 in this case would be 5 because C1 has 5 keypoints. So C2s second keypoint has an index of 7 ( 2 + 5) with respect to the list of keypoints in P.
member.param: The index of the component. Must be between 0 and Count-1.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTBoundaryGeometry.Exterior
member.summary: Returns or sets the geometry forming the exterior of the boundary. This is typically a polygon geometry.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTBoundaryGeometry.Holes
member.summary:
Returns the geometry collection representing the holes (excluded regions) of the boundary. Note that modifying this collection will modify the holes of the boundary.
Methods and properties for the IGTGeometryCollection object extend to the IGTBoundaryObject object through the Holes property. Therefore, geometry objects representing holes in the area defined by the exterior object can be added, removed, and individually returned through the Holes property.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTSymbology API.
member.remarks:
The IGTSymbology object defines symbology information for displaying queries. The object describes the visual graphic attributes of the text, symbols, areas, and lines used to display a query.
After setting the properties of the IGTSymbology object, you must set the Symbology property on the IGTPlotRedline object. Modifying the properties of the IGTSymbology object itself will have no effect unless you then set the Symbology property of the IGTPlotRedline object.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.Color
member.summary: Property to return/set the RGB color value to be used as an override. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override. GTStyleColorConstants can be used instead of a specific RGB value.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.FillColor
member.summary: Property to return/set the RGB fillcolor value to be used as an override. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override. GTStyleColorConstants can be used instead of a specific RGB value.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.Translucency
member.summary: Property to return/set the translucency value to be used as an override. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.FillTranslucency
member.summary: Property to return/set the fill translucency value to be used as an override. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.Size
member.summary: Property to return/set the symbol/text size to be used as an override. Size units are in Points (1 pt = 1/72 in) ranging from 1 to 500,000. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSymbology.Width
member.summary: Property to return/set the line/boundary width to be used as an override. Width units are in Points (1 pt = 1/72 in) ranging from 0 to 500,000. It defaults to Null, which indicates that this property should not be used as an override.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTSnapService API.
member.remarks: The IGTSnapService object provides the automation for snapping a point on or along a geometry object. The point that is snapped to can be constrained to snap to the ends, middle or existing vertices on the geometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SnapToGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint@)
member.summary: Method to analyze vector or raster data and snap to the closest location on the given geometry from a user-specified point within a user-specified tolerance. The (Raster)SnapTypesEnabled property determines the types of points to which to snap.
member.param: Input geometry to which to snap.
Input point used to snap to InputGeometry.
Point projected onto the SnapGeometry.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SnapToGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint@,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry@)
member.summary: Method to analyze vector or raster data and snap to the closest location on the given geometry from a user-specified point within a user-specified tolerance. The (Raster)SnapTypesEnabled property determines the types of points to which to snap.
member.param: Input geometry to which to snap.
Input point used to snap to InputGeometry.
Point projected onto the SnapGeometry.

Geometry to which the InputPoint was snapped. If the input geometry is a type that consists of multiple subgeometries, such as a boundary geometry, the SnapGeometry will be the subgeometry to which the input point was snapped.

The distance from the InputPoint to the SnapPoint.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SnapToGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint@,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry@,System.Double@,System.Int32@)

member.param: Input geometry to which to snap.
Input point used to snap to InputGeometry.
Point projected onto the SnapGeometry.
The distance from the InputPoint to the SnapPoint.

Geometry to which the InputPoint was snapped. If the input geometry is a type that consists of multiple subgeometries, such as a boundary geometry, the SnapGeometry will be the subgeometry to which the input point was snapped.

The index value (as related to the snapped geometry) of the vertex that is previous to the snapped point. When the input geometry on which the snap is being performed is not a type that can contain multiple subgeometries, then this value is the same as the KeyPointTotalIndex. When the input geometry is a type that can contain subgeometries, such as a boundary geometry, then this value would be the index as it relates to the subgeometry to which the point was snapped.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.GetClosedSymbolSize(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Method to return the minimum and maximum closed symbol size tolerance. These tolerances are used to determine the size of a closed symbol.
member.param: Minimum symbol size.
Maximum symbol size.
member.remarks:
The closed symbol size is the diameter of a closed or solid raster symbol.
Sizes are defined in units of the current configuration's DDCs.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SetClosedSymbolSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to set the minimum and maximum closed symbol size tolerance. These tolerances are used to determine the size of a closed symbol.
member.param: Minimum symbol size.
Maximum symbol size.
member.remarks:
The closed symbol size is the diameter of a closed or solid raster symbol.
This method will validate that the minimum size is smaller than the maximum size and that both values are positive.
Sizes are defined in units of the current configuration's DDCs.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.GetOpenSymbolSize(System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Method to return the minimum and maximum open symbol size tolerance. These tolerances are used to determine the size of a open symbol.
member.param: Minimum symbol size.
Maximum symbol size.
member.remarks:
The open symbol size is the diameter of the hole in an open raster symbol.
Sizes are defined in units of the current configuration's DDCs.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SetOpenSymbolSize(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to set the minimum and maximum open symbol size tolerance. These tolerances are used to determine the size of a open symbol.
member.param: Minimum symbol size.
Maximum symbol size.
member.remarks:
The open symbol size is the diameter of the hole in an open raster symbol.
This method will validate that the minimum size is smaller than the maximum size and that both values are positive.
Sizes are defined in units of the current configuration's DDCs.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.RasterNoiseTolerance
member.summary: Property to return/set the maximum size of a raster element, measured across the element, that the software should ignore when performing raster snaps.
member.remarks:
An original IDL definition of RasterNoiseTolerance property was the following: double RasterNoiseTolerance;
This value is in ground units (DDC coordinates of the current configuration).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.RasterSnapTolerance
member.summary: Property to return/set the distance from the input point from which to search for snap points for snapping to geometries and symbols within a raster geometry.
member.remarks: This value is in ground units (DDC coordinates of the current configuration).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.RasterSnapTypesEnabled
member.summary: Property to return/set how to snap to lines and symbols within a raster geometry.
member.remarks: These values can be combined together as a mask to allow snapping to multiple snap types.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SnapTolerance
member.summary: Property to return/set the distance from the input point from which to search for snap points for vector snapping.
member.remarks: This value is in ground units (DDC coordinates of the current configuration).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSnapService.SnapTypesEnabled
member.summary: Property to return/set how to snap to vector geometry. You can snap to end points, vertices, origin, corners, mid-point or anywhere along a geometry object.
member.remarks: These values can be combined together as a mask to allow snapping to multiple snap types.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTGraphicComponent API.
member.remarks: IGTGraphicComponent object returns geometric and other key information about the component currently being placed as well as the already-digitized components of the current feature instance.

member.summary: Property to return the metadata-defined arguments for this placing this component.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.CID
member.summary: Property to return the component identifier.

member.summary: Property to return the component number.
member.remarks: This property is populated from the G3E_CNO field of either the G3E_FEATURECOMPONENT or G3E_PLACEMENTCONFIGURATION table.

member.summary: Property to return the component name (G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_NAME).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.DetailID
member.summary: Property to return the detail identifier for this component.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.FeatureIndex
member.summary: Property to return the G3E_PLACEMENTCONFIGURATION.G3E_FEATUREINDEX value for this component. This property is meaningful in the context of placement configurations only.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.FID
member.summary: Property to return the feature identifier.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.FNO
member.summary: Property to return the feature number.
member.remarks: This property is populated from the G3E_FNO field of either the G3E_FEATURECOMPONENT or G3E_PLACEMENTCONFIGUATION table.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.Geometry
member.summary: Property to return the current geometry for this component.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGraphicComponent.GeometryType
member.summary: Property to return the component geometry type (G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_GEOMETRYTYPE).
member.remarks:
The possible values are GTGeometryTypeConstants. Of these, feature placement supports only the following:
BoundaryGeometry
CompositePolygonGeometry
CompositePolylineGeometry
OrientedPointGeometry
PolygonGeometry
PolylineGeometry
RasterGeometry
TextPointGeometry
The CompositePolylineGeometry and CompositePolygonGeometry types are comprised of PolylineGeometry and ArcGeometry types only. The IGTBoundaryGeometry.Holes property is of type IGTGeometryCollection, and is a collection of CompositePolygonGeometry types. Feature placement does not support the placement of holes, but the Edit tool does.

members.member:
Intergraph G/Technology IGTGeometryEditService Interface. /// The IGTGeometryEditService can:
Add geometry objects to and remove geometry objects from IGTGeometryEditService.
Add vertices to and remove vertices from geometry objects.
Get a geometry object from IGTGeometryEditService.
Move or rotate a geometry object.
Cancel the move or rotate action on a geometry object.
Select and deselect specific geometry keypoints or all geometry keypoints.
Select all keypoints. This simplifies moving or rotating a feature.
Return the count of all the geometry objects in IGTGeometryEditService.
Set the active map window on IGTGeometryEditService. The edited geometry will be displayed only in a single map window at any one time.
See if a specified keypoint is selected.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.AddGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to add a geometry object to the collection of geometry objects in the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The geometry to be added.

The style ID specifying the symbology to be used to display the geometry being added. Corresponds to the G3E_SNO value in metadata. Alternately, the StyleID can be one of the GTStyleIDConstants values.
member.remarks: Default values false and true are used for DisplayHandles and SelectAllKeyPoints.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.AddGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to add a geometry object to the collection of geometry objects in the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The geometry to be added.

The style ID specifying the symbology to be used to display the geometry being added. Corresponds to the G3E_SNO value in metadata. Alternately, the StyleID can be one of the GTStyleIDConstants values.

A flag that tells IGTGeometryEditService to display the handles. The default value is False, which means no handles are displayed. If True, then handles for all keypoints are displayed using the same style Edit tool uses to display handles when the Manipulate Vertex tool is selected. SelectAllKeyPoints overrides this argument and, if the SelectAllKeyPoints argument is True, all keypoints are displayed using the selected style from the value of the DisplayHandles argument.
member.remarks: Default value true is used for SelectAllKeyPoints.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.AddGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Method to add a geometry object to the collection of geometry objects in the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The geometry to be added.

The style ID specifying the symbology to be used to display the geometry being added. Corresponds to the G3E_SNO value in metadata. Alternately, the StyleID can be one of the GTStyleIDConstants values.

A flag that tells IGTGeometryEditService to display the handles. The default value is False, which means no handles are displayed. If True, then handles for all keypoints are displayed using the same style Edit tool uses to display handles when the Manipulate Vertex tool is selected. SelectAllKeyPoints overrides this argument and, if the SelectAllKeyPoints argument is True, all keypoints are displayed using the selected style from the value of the DisplayHandles argument.
A flag that tells IGTGeometryEditService to select all the keypoints for the specified geometry object for any move or rotate operation. The default value is True.
member.remarks:
The StyleID can be retrieved by using IGTHelperService.GetComponentStyleID or by querying metadata. You must specify a style that matches the geometry type of the Geometry parameter.
Example: If the Geometry parameter references a polyline geometry, GeometryStyleID must reference a linear style.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.GetGeometry(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to return the specified geometry object from the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The index of the geometry to be returned in the collection of geometries in IGTGeometryEditService. The collection of geometries is indexed starting with 1.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.RemoveGeometry(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometry)
member.summary: Method to remove the specified geometry object from the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The geometry object that is being removed.
member.remarks: The item can be specified by the variable used for the geometry object when it was added to the collection or by its index within the collection.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.RemoveGeometry(System.Int32)
member.summary: Method to remove the specified geometry object from the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.param: The Index of the geometry object that is being removed.
member.remarks: The item can be specified by the variable used for the geometry object when it was added to the collection or by its index within the collection.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.RemoveAllGeometries
member.summary: Method to remove all the geometry objects from the IGTGeometryEditService.
member.remarks: This method does not have to be called before releasing IGTGeometryEditService. IGTGeometryEditService will call RemoveAllGeometries during its destruction.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.BeginMove(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to initiate the move geometry action.
member.param: The reference point for the move.
member.remarks: The BeginMove method requires a reference point as input. This reference point is the start point of the move. The move action is performed on all selected keypoints.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.Move(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to dynamically display the position of a geometry that is being moved.
member.param: The temporary end point for the move.
member.remarks:
The Move method must be called after a BeginMove and before the EndMove method. Otherwise, an error results.
The dynamics are displayed in the window specified by the TargetMapWindow property.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.EndMove(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to complete the move geometry action.
member.param: The stop point for the move.
member.remarks: The EndMove method must be called after the BeginMove method has been called. Otherwise, an error is raised.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.CancelMove
member.summary: Method to cancel the move geometry action.
member.remarks: Calling either the Move method or the EndMove method after calling the CancelMove method will result in an error. The action must be restarted by calling the BeginMove method first.

The item can be designated by the variable used for the geometry object when it was added to the collection or by its index within the collection.

member.summary: Method to insert a vertex (point) into a geometry object before the vertex at the input index.
member.param: The specific geometry object in the collection.
The index of the vertex that the inserted vertex is to precede.
The IGTPoint object to insert.

member.remarks: Calling either the Rotate method or the EndRotate method after calling the CancelRotate method will result in an error. Call the BeginRotate method to restart the rotate action.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.BeginMoveAndRotate(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to initiate the move and rotate geometry action.
member.param: The reference point for the move.
The start angle (in degrees) for the rotate.
member.remarks:
This is one of two methods required to move and rotate simultaneously all or part of a geometry object. The other required method is EndMoveAndRotate. BeginMoveAndRotate will affect any geometry added to IGTGeometryEditService for the key points that have been selected.
The BeginMoveAndRotate method requires a reference point and start angle (in degrees) as input. This reference point is the start point of the move operation. The difference of the rotation angle specified by the EndMoveAndRotate method and the start angle provides the offset angle by which the geometry is to be rotated indicating that the start angle acts as a base angle. The move and rotate action is performed on all selected keypoints.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.MoveAndRotate(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to dynamically display the position of a geometry that is being moved and rotated simultaneously.
member.param: The temporary end point for the move. It is also the point around which the geometry will be rotated.
The rotation angle (in degrees) provides the temporary angle by which the geometry is to be rotated around the specified point.
member.remarks:
The MoveAndRotate method must be called after the BeginMoveAndRotate method and before the EndMoveAndRotate method.
The dynamics are displayed in the window specified by the TargetMapWindow property.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.EndMoveAndRotate(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Method to complete the move and rotate geometry action.
member.param: The stop point for the move and the point around which the geometry will be rotated.
The final rotation angle (in degrees).
member.remarks: The EndMoveAndRotate method must be called after the BeginMoveAndRotate method has been called.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.CancelMoveAndRotate
member.summary: Method to cancel the move and rotate geometry action.
member.remarks: Calling either the MoveAndRotate method or the EndMoveAndRotate method after calling the CancelMove method will result in an error. The action must be restarted by calling the BeginMoveAndRotate method first.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTGeometryEditService.TargetMapWindow
member.summary: Property to return/set the IGTMapWindow where IGTGeometryEditService renders (draws) the geometries.
member.remarks:
You must set this property to use IGTGeometryEditService. The edited geometry and any associated dynamics will be displayed only in this map window.
Setting the TargetMapWindow property resets the current edit state. That is, if you have called one of the Begin methods and then set this property again, you must reestablish the edit state by calling the appropriate Begin method again.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTSelectedObjects API.
member.remarks:
The IGTSelectedObjects object is used to manage adding and removing feature components to or from the application's select set.
If there is a transaction in progress, this object prevents any changes to the select set from occurring.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTNameObjectCollectionBase
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTNameObjectCollectionBase API.
member.remarks: IGTProperties and IGTSelectedObjects derives from IGTNameObjectCollectionBase. For internal use only.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects.Add(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.GTSelectModeConstants,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTDDCKeyObject)
member.summary: Method to add an item to the set of selected objects.
member.param: Specifies which components, for the specified feature, are added to the collection of selected objects in the application.
The DDC key object of the component view selected by the user for the feature to add to the IGTSelectedObjects collection.
member.remarks: Use this method to add a feature to the selected objects collection based on a selection in the map window. If this method is called while a database transaction is in progress, an error will be raised.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects.BeginModify
member.summary: Method to begin a group of operations that modify the set of selected objects.
member.remarks:
This is used to suppress any notification to select set listeners regarding the additions until the EndModify method is called.
Use this method when several components or features will be added to the IGTSelectedObjects collection. This will prevent having processing by select-set listeners occur for each addition, such as when the fit selected option is used for the map view.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects.EndModify
member.summary: Method to end a group of operations that modify the set of selected objects.
member.remarks:
Listeners to the selected objects collection will be notified of the additions at this point. If no BeginModify was called, this method is ignored.
Use this method when several components or features will be added to the IGTSelectedObjects collection. This will prevent having processing by select-set listeners occur for each addition, such as when the fit selected option is used for the map view.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects.Clear
member.summary: Method to clear the set of selected objects.
member.remarks: Use this method to clear all features from the IGTSelectedObjects collection. If this method is called while a database transaction is in progress, an error will be raised.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSelectedObjects.GetObjects
member.summary: Method to return the set of selected objects.
member.remarks:
Use this method to retrieve a IGTDDCKeyObjects collection for features in the selected objects collection.
Each nongraphic feature or graphic feature with no graphic instances will return a single IGTDDCKeyObject. This IGTDDCKeyObject contains a recordset with all four feature-component identifier keys (G3E_FNO, G3E_FID, G3E_CNO, and G3E_CID). This recordset is accessed through the GTDDCKeyObject objects Recordset property. The recordset returned is the first valid component recordset found for the component views specified in G3E_FEATURECOMPS_OPTABLE for the features G3E_FNO, where G3E_TYPE = 1.

member.param: The key of the component view of a feature to check for in the application's IGTSelectedObjects collection.
member.remarks: Use this method to determine if a feature is selected.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSchematicLabels
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTSchematicLabels API.
member.remarks:
IGTSchematicLabels is a collection of labels associated with a schematic element. This collection contains one element for each label specified in metadata for the associated feature.
The collection can be modified, including adding items to or removing items from the collection. This allows the you to override the metadata specification for labels.
When the Generate method is called on the parent IGTSchematicElement, or when the IGTAugmentNetworkAttribution object returns from its Execute method, the data in this collection is used to generate labels for the element in XML. One label is generated for each element in this collection.

member.param: The index of the label to remove.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTPoint API.
member.remarks:
The IGTPoint object represents a 3-D position or location. The coordinates for the point can be returned or modified through its X, Y, and Z properties. When the object is used as a WorldPoint as input to the automation methods, the X, Y, and Z coordinates are expected to be in the units of the published data associated with your current configuration. These units may be different from the storage in your database but will be transformed by the G/Technology software when transferred to the database.
A IGTPoint is distinct from the IGTPointGeometry in that the IGTPoint object is an X, Y, Z position in space that describes higher Geometry objects. This point can be a member of the IGTPoints collection. As a members of the collection, IGTPoint objects describe multiple positions in a PolylineGeometry object or a PolylineGeometry object.
The IGTPointGeometry object is a type of geometry object, as are LineGeometry, PolylineGeometry, and PolylineGeometry objects. This IGTPointGeometry object can be a member of the GeometryCollection object.
Usage note: In the older COM-based API for G/Technology, some methods and properties that returned a IGTPoint could return an object that implicitly referenced another object, such as a geometry object. Modifying the coordinates of that IGTPoint object would therefore implicitly modify the referenced geometry.
This IGTPoint class never behaves in that fashion. Whenever a IGTPoint object is retrieved from another object, the returned IGTPoint is always a copy of the information from the source object.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.Equals(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)

member.param: Point to compare for equality.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.Equals(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary:
A IGTPoint equals another GTPoint if they contain the same coordinates.
, which compares points based on a positional tolerance. The == and != operators, as well as the Equals method, compare the coordinate values for exact equality.
member.param: Point 1
Point 2

member.summary: Two IGTPoint objects are not equal if they do not contain the same coordinates.
member.param: Point 1
Point 2

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.ProjectTo(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSegment)
member.summary: The ProjectTo function projects this point on to a given line segment.
member.param: Segment.
member.remarks: The return is the perpendicular projection of the point onto the segment. If the projection is not on the segment, and the segment's IsExtended property is false, then the point returned is the nearest end point (with Type property equal to GTSegmentPointType.gtsptOnEndpoint). If the projection is not on the segment, and the segment's IsExtended property is true, then the point returned is the perpendicular projection of the point onto the extended segment (with Type property equal to GTSegmentPointType.gtsptOnExtendedSegment). If the projected point is on the segment, the Type property of the return value will be GTSegmentPointType.gtsptOnSegment.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.IsContainedBy(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoints)
member.summary: The IsContainedBy function determines whether a point is inside a polygon.
member.remarks: Returns gtiptOutside if the point is outside the polygon, gtiptOnPolygon if on the polygon, and gtiptInside if it is in the polygon.
member.param: The vertices of the polygon to be tested.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.IsOn(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSegment)
member.summary: Determines if a point is on the segment. If the segment's IsExtended property is true, this function raises an exception.
member.param: Segment

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint.ProjectAtAngle(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTSegment,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a projected point by deriving the lines that pass through the anchor point at the specified angle increment from the original line segment and then projecting the reference point onto the closest derived line.
member.remarks:
Uses positional tolerance.
The angle increment must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 180 degrees.
The extendability of the input segment is ignored.
member.param: The point through which the reference lines pass.
The angle in degrees between the reference lines and the input segment.
The original line segment.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTPlotMap API.
member.remarks: A IGTPlotMap object provides access to properties and methods that are specific to an embedded map.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.CenterSelectedObjects
member.summary: Method to center the IGTPlotMap on the selected objects.
member.remarks:
The CenterSelectedObjects method finds the center point of the IGTApplication's SelectedObjects property, and then moves this center point to the center of the IGTPlotMap.
The center point of IGTApplication's SelectedObjects property is determined using the center of the minimum bounding rectangle (MBR) of all selected geometries.
The map frame must be activated when this method is called; otherwise an error is raised.
If there is no object in IGTApplication's SelectedObjects property, this method does nothing and returns without error.
After calling this method, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the map to redraw.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.FitAll
member.summary: Method to fit the IGTPlotMap with all of its displayable objects.
member.remarks:
The map frame must be activated when this method is called; otherwise an error is raised.
After calling this method, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the map to redraw.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.FitSelectedObjects(System.Double)
member.summary: Method to fit the IGTPlotMap with the selected objects.
member.param: The zoom factor to use when fitting the selected objects collection.
member.remarks:
The map frame must be activated when this method is called; otherwise an error is raised.
If ZoomFactor is less than or equal to 1.0, no zoom out operation will be performed.
If there is no object in IGTApplication's SelectedObjects property, this method does nothing and returns without error.
After calling this method, you must call the IGTApplication's RefreshWindows method to cause the map to redraw.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.GetRange
member.summary: Method to return the range of the area displayed in the IGTPlotMap.
member.remarks:
The map frame must be activated when this method is called; otherwise an error is raised.
The range is in world coordinates and spans from the lower-left to the upper-right of the map frame. This range is not affected by any clipping polygon applied to the map frame.
Resizing the window or recentering, panning, or zooming the objects in the map frame changes the range values.
GetRange returns the world range of the map, whereas IGTPlotFrame.Range returns the paper range of the map frame. The two sets of coordinates are related by the display scale of the map and the position of the frame on the sheet.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.ZoomArea(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTWorldRange)
member.summary: Method to zoom to the range of the given area.
member.param: The area for which the zoom will occur.
member.remarks:
The ZoomArea method fills the map frame with the portion of the display contained within a specified rectangular area. The rectangular area is defined by specifying in world coordinates its lower-left and upper-right corners through the IGTWorldRange object. The objects in the embedded map resize proportionally to fill the window.
The area filled is the unclipped area of the map frame - that is, any clipping polygon applied to the frame has no effect on the results of ZoomArea.
The map frame must be activated when this method is called; otherwise an error is raised.
The map frame is refreshed automatically after the zoom operation.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.PaperToWorld(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to convert paper coordinates to their corresponding world coordinates.
member.param: The paper point from which to convert.
member.remarks:
The world coordinate value depends on the units of resolution for the IGTPlotMap coordinate system.
The paper coordinates must fall within a IGTPlotFrame that contains the specified map. However, they need not fall within the clipping polygon, if any, applied to that map frame.
This method may be called only when the plot containing this map is displayed in a plot window and the map frame is activated.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.WorldToPaper(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint)
member.summary: Method to convert world coordinates to their corresponding paper coordinates.
member.param: The world point from which to convert.
member.remarks:
The world coordinates must fall within the area displayed in a IGTPlotFrame. However, they need not fall within the clipping polygon, if any, applied to that map frame.
This method may be called only when the plot containing this map is displayed in a plot window and the map frame is activated.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.DetailID
member.summary: Property to return the detail identifier for the IGTPlotMap.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.DisplayScale
member.summary: Property to return/set the number of units on the ground represented by one unit on the screen.
member.remarks:
Setting this property to a value less than 1 will result in an error message.
This property takes effect immediately, and there is no need to perform a refresh.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlotMap.BackColor

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMath
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTMath API.
member.remarks: IGTMath interface is implemented by GTMath which provides a set of general math functions that are not specific to particular data types.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMath.CircleIntersectCircle(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the intersection of two circles defined by center point and radius. If the circles do not intersect, an empty array is returned. If the two circles overlap, an array with a single element is returned with a Type property of gtsptOverlap. Otherwise, one or two elements are returned with Type property gtsptOnSegment.
member.param: Center of the first circle
Radius of the first circle
Center of the second circle
Radius of the second circle

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMath.PositionalTolerance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the positional tolerance used in comparing coordinate-related quantities. . .
Use this function with care; modifying this value could adversely affect the operation of your application. If you need a specific tolerance value only for a given operation, save the old tolerance, modify it, perform your operation, then restore the original tolerance value. The default value of this property is based on the coordinate system, and is generally the appropriate value to use when comparing geographic coordinates.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTMath.SquaredPositionalTolerance
member.summary: Returns the square of the PositionalTolerance value. In many cases, such as when comparing distances, it is more convenient to compare the square of the value (e.g., the squared distance) to the squared tolerance, in order to avoid a square-root operation. This property provides the squared tolerance directly. .

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService
member.summary: Intergraph G/Technology IGTJobManagementService API.
member.remarks: The IGTJobManagementService object should only be used in custom commands that manage job operations. These custom job commands should include the New transaction available enabling condition so that a user cannot accidentally run them while another transaction is in progress.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.DiscardJob
member.summary: Method to discard a job.
member.remarks: To refresh the job environment after DiscardJob has been called, use RefreshJobEnvironment.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.PostJob
member.summary: Method to post the current job.
member.remarks: To refresh the job environment after PostJob has been called, use RefreshJobEnvironment.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.ValidateFeatures(ADODB.Recordset)
member.summary: Method to validate feature(s).
member.param: Defines the feature or features to be validated. The input recordset must contain the G3E_FNO and G3E_FID fields.
member.remarks:
The IGTJobManagementService returns a recordset containing all errors found. The format of the recordset is as follows:
"ErrorPriority", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorDescription", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorLocation", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"Connection", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"G3E_FNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_FID", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CID", adInteger, NUMBER
Field Description
ErrorPriority The severity of the error, with P1 being the most severe.
ErrorDescription Describes the error.
ErrorLocation The software module that generated the error or the type of error identified, such as attribute or relationship.
Connection The database connection name.
G3E_FNO The feature number, which is the feature type.
G3E_FID The feature ID, which identifies the set of records that constitute a feature.
G3E_CNO The component number, which is the component type.
G3E_CID The component occurrence identifier, which identifies the sequence of a particular component record when a feature component can have repeating records.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.ValidatePendingEdits
member.summary: Method to validate all features with pending edits.
member.remarks:
This method should be used to validate all of the edits within a job.
The GTJobManagementService returns a recordset containing all errors found. The format of the recordset is as follows:
"ErrorPriority", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorDescription", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorLocation", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"Connection", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"G3E_FNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_FID", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CID", adInteger, NUMBER
Field Description
ErrorPriority The severity of the error, with P1 being the most severe.
ErrorDescription Describes the error.
ErrorLocation The software module that generated the error or the type of error identified, such as attribute or relationship.
Connection The database connection name.
G3E_FNO The feature number, which is the feature type.
G3E_FID The feature ID, which identifies the set of records that constitute a feature.
G3E_CNO The component number, which is the component type.
G3E_CID The component occurrence identifier, which identifies the sequence of a particular component record when a feature component can have repeating records.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.PartialPostFeatures(ADODB.Recordset)
member.summary: Method to post partial edits from a job.
member.param: Defines the feature or features to be posted to master. The input recordset must contain the G3E_FNO and G3E_FID fields.
member.remarks:
The PartialPostFeatures method is used to post to master one or more features from a given job without posting all features of the job.
If no validation or post errors are found, the features will be posted and an integer value of gtjmsNoError is returned. Otherwise, the method returns an integer value indicating the type of error; and you can use the PostErrors property to see what errors prevented the post.
If the application is available, progress reporting to the application's status bar is providedPreparing ..., Validating ..., Detecting Conflicts ..., or Posting ....
To refresh the job environment after PartialPostFeatures has been called, use RefreshJobEnvironment.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.DiscardFeatureEdits(ADODB.Recordset)
member.summary: Method to discard edits for a given feature or set of features.
member.param: Defines the feature or features to have their edits discarded. The input recordset must contain a populated G3E_FID field.
member.remarks:
The DiscardFeatureEdits method calls the database procedure that discards all edits to a feature or set of features within the active job by removing:
All rows in the LTT_UNDO_LOG table
All edits from the B$ tables for the feature or set of features
All edits to the features in the collection will be discarded, regardless of the number of transactions in which the features participate.
Because discarding feature edits could affect the outcome of a running edit operation, features may only be discarded when the client is not running a transaction. An error will be raised if a transaction is active when this method is called.
To refresh the job environment after DiscardFeatureEditshas been called, use RefreshJobEnvironment.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.RefreshJobEnvironment
member.summary: Method to reset the job environment.
member.remarks:
The RefreshJobEnvironment method is used to refresh the G/Technology environment. This method does the following:
Clears the UndoManager list.
Clears the select set.
Broadcasts database changes.
Refreshes the views.
Clears Feature Explorer.
This method should be called after one or more post or discard operations.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.CloseJob
member.summary: Method to post any pending edits in the active job and mark the job as closed in the job table.
member.remarks: Calling CloseJob prevents further edits from being associated with this job.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.CopyJob(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to create a replica of an existing job in the context of a new job of the current connection.
member.param: The name of the job containing the data to copy.
The name of the job to create. The data from the oldJobName will be copied into the new job.
member.remarks: Calling CopyJob is analogous to executing the Copy function from the Job Environment command.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.CreateJob
member.summary: to create a job on the current connection. The job is not automatically made active. Use the EditJob method to perform that task.
member.remarks: Calling CreateJob is analogous to executing the CreateJob command without the option to set the job active.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.CreateJob(System.String)
member.summary: to create a job on the current connection. The job is not automatically made active. Use the EditJob method to perform that task.
member.param: The name of the job to create.
member.remarks: Calling CreateJob is analogous to executing the CreateJob command without the option to set the job active.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.EditJob(System.String)
member.summary: Method to begin an edit session for the specified job i.e. makes the specified job active.
member.param: The name of the job to edit (make active).
member.remarks: Calling EditJob method is analogous to the Make Active operation in the job-management commands and the ltt_user.editjob database procedure. This method adds the job to the connection, if it is not already the only one in the list, and makes it active for editing. If there are already jobs in the list, they are released. While multiple connections are possible, only one job can be attached to a connection. In other words, there can be only one attached connection when editing a job.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.EndEditJob
member.summary: Method to terminate the edit session for the job currently being edited.
member.remarks: The job remains in the viewed jobs list.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.FindConflicts
member.summary: Method to get the list of conflicting feature keys for job data that conflicts with master data.
member.returns: The list of feature keys for job data that conflicts with master data.
member.remarks: The FindConflicts method compares the job currently being edited against the master database and reports, at the table level, where conflicts exist. It does not report the specific conflict. FindConflicts uses the database procedure to find the conflicts. It creates a ADODB.recordset against the table populated by the procedure. FindConflicts works only if there is a job in Edit mode as, for example, when EditJob has been previously called. The output ADODB.Recordset includes the feature keys, the name of the table, the descriptive name of the feature, and the LTT status (edit, add, delete). The recordset returned is ordered by G3E_FID, G3E_FNO, G3E_CID, and G3E_CNO.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.FindPendingEdits
member.summary: Method to get the pending work associated with the active job.
member.returns: The set of keys for all the components that currently have proposed additions, modifications or deletions.
member.remarks: FindPendingEdits works only if there is a job in Edit mode as, for example, when EditJob has been previously called. The output ADODB.Recordset includes the feature keys, the name of the table, the descriptive name of the feature, and the LTT status (edit, add, delete). The recordset returned is ordered by G3E_FID, G3E_FNO, G3E_CID, and G3E_CNO.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.RemoveJob(System.String)
member.summary: Method to remove the job from the list of currently viewed jobs.
member.param: The name of the job to remove.
member.remarks: If the specified job currently being edited then the edit session is terminated. Calling the RemoveJob method with an invalid job name or a job name not currently viewed results in an exception being thrown. Calling RemoveJob does not post or discard edits for the job. RemoveJob stops the viewing of a job.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.ViewJob(System.String)
member.summary: Method to add specified job for viewing.
member.param: The name of the job to view.
member.remarks: Calling ViewJob method is analogous to adding a job in the job environment or using the ltt_user.viewjob procedure. This method may be called repeatedly to view multiple jobs. Exception is thrown if specified job is already active or in the job list.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.DataContext
member.summary: Property to return/set the DataContext object.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTJobManagementService.PostErrors
member.summary: Property to return the PostErrors recordset.
member.remarks:
If the error resulted from validation (gtjmsValidation), the format of the recordset will be as follows:
"ErrorPriority", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorDescription", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"ErrorLocation", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"Connection", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"G3E_FNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_FID", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CID", adInteger, NUMBER
Field Description
ErrorPriority The severity of the error, with P1 being the most severe.
ErrorDescription Describes the error.
ErrorLocation The software module that generated the error or the type of error identified, such as attribute or relationship.
Connection The database connection name.
G3E_FNO The feature number, which is the feature type.
G3E_FID The feature ID, which identifies the set of records that constitute a feature.
G3E_CNO The component number, which is the component type.
G3E_CID The component occurrence identifier, which identifies the sequence of a particular component record when a feature component can have repeating records.
If the error resulted from a conflict detection (gtjmsConflict), the format of the recordset will be from the CONFLICTS table as follows:
"TABLE_NAME", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"JOB_NAME", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
"G3E_FID", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CID", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_FNO", adInteger, NUMBER
"G3E_CNO", adInteger, NUMBER
If the error resulted from a database error encountered (gtjmsDatabase), the format of the recordset will be as follows:
"ErrorDescription", adVarWChar, VARCHAR2
ErrorDescription describes the error. The client should be aware that this property could return Nothing if there are no errors.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional
member.summary: The Intergraph G/Technology IGTFunctional Interface assigns attribute values or generates additional components based on a user-entered value.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Execute
member.summary: Method called when a component instance is created, or when one of its values is modified, or when it is updated.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Delete
member.summary: Method called when a component instance is deleted.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Validate(System.String[]@,System.String[]@)
member.summary: Method called when a feature is validated.
member.remarks:
There is a one-to-one correspondence between the error priorities in the ErrorPriorityArray and the error messages in the ErrorMessageArray.
You should include logic in the Validate method to ensure that post fails based on any business rules you are implementing with the Functional interface.
The software allows some validation errors to be accepted when posting the data. See the validation processing description for more details and specifically the discussion of the error filtering parameters to determine the proper value to specify for your workflow.
member.param: Returns the priority of any errors that were detected while validating. This array is expected to be string data. The format of the error priority should be consistent with the values used by the product software and other custom interfaces. By default, these take the form of P1, P2, P3, and P4.
Returns the actual error messages detected while validating.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Arguments
member.summary: Property to return/set the metadata-defined arguments for this interface.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.ComponentName
member.summary: Property to return/set the component name (G3E_COMPONENT.G3E_NAME) of the component that caused the functional interface to execute.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Components
member.summary: Property to return/set the components collection of the feature being edited.
member.remarks:
Use the Components property to set up a IGTComponents object through which you can access various components in the feature.
The Components property contains all components for the current feature.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.DataContext
member.summary: Property to return/set the IGTDataContext object associated with this interface.
member.remarks: The DataContext property lets you set up a GTDataContext object through which you can perform database operations and access published metadata.

member.summary: Property to return/set the field name (G3E_ATTRIBUTE.G3E_FIELD) of the attribute from the component recordset that caused the functional interface to execute.

FieldValueBeforeChange may be used for comparison when executing the Functional interface.
If the Functional interface is associated with the geometry field, the value of this property is the geometry object before it was changed.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTFunctional.Type
member.summary: Property to return/set the type of the functional interface being executed.
member.remarks: The Type property allows the Functional interface to determine the recordset activity that caused the Functional interface to fire.

member.summary: Method called to execute the interface and report on the data as required.
member.remarks: The Execute method is called after the recordset is created by the calling command. This method takes as input the recordset from a trace or query, performs any additional processing, and then presents the report using any display technique available. The interface does not specify nor support any particular form for display.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModal
member.summary: The Intergraph G/Technology IGTCustomCommandModal Interface allows building of custom commands for which processing is completed in the Activiate method. No input is required from the user other than what is collected by the modal forms for the command to display.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModal.Activate
member.summary: Method called to start the modal command. It is called each time the command is invoked.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModal.TransactionManager
member.summary: Property to set the IGTTransactionManager object so that the custom command can make edits to the database under transaction control.
member.remarks:
The modal command must be classified as an Edit command for this property to be set.
This property is set if the custom command is set as a transaction command. A transaction command has an active job available when the command is first invoked, and an enabling condition marked "New transaction available". This implies that the "Active job exists" enabling condition should also be set.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless
member.summary: The Intergraph G/Technology IGTCustomCommandModeless Interface allows building of custom commands that extend existing G/Technology capability, and provides access to these commands through the G/Technology Tools > Custom Command menu.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.Activate(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTCustomCommandHelper)
member.summary: Method called to start the modeless command. It is called each time the command is invoked.
member.param: The IGTCustomCommandHelper object available to modeless custom commands

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.Terminate
member.summary: Method called when the modeless custom command is about to be released. This method is called when the command is reloaded, as in a Refresh Metadata Edits operation, or when canceled by a higher priority command.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.Pause
member.summary: Method called when the modeless custom command is interrupted by another command.
member.remarks: This provides an opportunity for the command to cache its current state.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.Resume
member.summary: Method called when the modeless custom command is being restarted after a Pause has been executed.
member.remarks: This provides an opportunity for the command to check the validity of its cache and then resume processingmost likely waiting on user input.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.CanTerminate
member.summary: Property to return whether the modeless custom command is ready to be terminated. Sometimes this means the command will pop up a dialog box and ask if the user really wants to end the command and lose the uncommitted work that has been done so far, or whether to ignore the request to start a conflicting command and return to working on this command.
member.remarks: The Property returns True (can terminate) or False (cannot terminate at present).

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTCustomCommandModeless.TransactionManager
member.summary: Property to set the IGTTransactionManager object so that the custom command can make edits to the database under transaction control.
member.remarks:
The modeless command must be classified as an Edit command for this property to be set.
This property is set if the custom command is set as a transaction command. A transaction command has an active job available when the command is first invoked, and an enabling condition marked "New transaction available". This implies that the "Active job exists" enabling condition should also be set.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear
member.summary: The Intergraph G/Technology IGTPostBreakLinear Interface is leveraged by objects called from BreakLinearService, and is used primarily as a cleanup point during break.
member.remarks: At the point that Post Break Linear objects are called, the break has been completed, all components have been destined and graphically adjusted, and all relationships have been reassigned appropriately. This step follows the bulk of break work and precedes the establishing of relationships between a breaking feature and the two features resulting from the break. Since this step follows all break geometry work, it is a logical place to do any work that would require the actual updated geometries for purpose of attribution updates.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.Execute
member.summary: Method called to perform the work of the post break linear interface.
member.remarks: After all of the properties are set, this method is called so that the object implementing the IGTPostBreakLinear interface can do its work.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.Arguments
member.summary: Property to return/set the metadata-defined arguments for this interface.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.BreakFeature
member.summary: Property to return/set the break (linear) feature. Its FID property is that of the feature that was broken. Its CNO and CID properties indicate the component instance that was broken.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.BreakRatio
member.summary: Property to return/set the ratio along the linear, before the break occurred, of the component instance that was broken.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.DataContext
member.summary: Property to return/set the IGTDataContext object associated with this interface.
member.remarks: The DataContext property grants the interface object access to the database and published metadata.

member.name: P:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPostBreakLinear.NewFeature
member.summary: Property to return/set the new feature resulting from the break operation.
member.remarks: This IGTKeyObject represents the new feature of the break operation and can be used in the updating of feature attribution and geometry.

member.name: T:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPlacementTechnique
member.summary: The Intergraph G/Technology IGTPlacementTechnique Interface constructs the graphic components (geometry) of a feature.

member.name: M:Intergraph.GTechnology.Interfaces.IGTPlacementTechnique.StartPlacement(Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTPlacementTechniqueHelper,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObject,Intergraph.GTechnology.API.IGTKeyObjects)

The key object for the feature currently being placed. This key object also exists in the KeyObjectCollection.
